Title:
Double-digest RADseq loci using standard Illumina indexes
improve deep and shallow phylogenetic resolution of Lophodermium, a
widespread fungal endophyte of pine needles
Abstract:
Restriction site-associated DNA sequencing with universal
indexes provides a cost-efficient option for reduced-representation
genome sequencing that is especially attractive for non-model species.
This study avoids barcoded adapters and incorporates standard indexes
for sequencing fifty samples from six putative species of Lophodermium,
a diverse genus of fungal endophytes whose phylogenetic and population
genetic analyses have been limited by the scarcity of informative
genetic markers. The combination of low similarity clustering (70%) and
relaxed quality-filtering (allowing up to 30 ambiguous sites per read)
performed the best in phylogenetic analyses at both recent and deep
genetic divergences.
